Accessible Color Palette Generator
- Single-file Python 3 script using only standard library (os, json, pathlib, argparse, curses, webbrowser, urllib.parse).
- CLI app with curses TUI for generating accessible color palettes (WCAG AA compliant contrast ratios).
- Core features:
  * Interactive curses interface with keyboard navigation (arrow keys, Enter, Tab, Esc to quit).
  * Generate palettes: random, analogous, complementary, triadic schemes from base color input.
  * Color picker mode: input hex/RGB via keyboard, preview 5-7 color variants in real-time.
  * Contrast checker: test foreground/background pairs, highlight passing WCAG ratios (>=4.5:1).
  * ARIA-equivalent announcements via curses status bar for screen readers (e.g., "Palette generated: Blue #007BFF").
- Persistence: save/load palettes as JSON to ~/.colorpalettes.json (auto-backup on exit).
- Share feature: generate shareable URL hash (base64-encoded palette data via urllib.parse.urlencode), open in browser with webbrowser.open().
- Drag-drop simulation: curses "drag" colors between slots using Shift+arrows for reordering.
- Command-line args: python app.py --base #007BFF --scheme analogous --share (auto-generates and opens URL).
- Testable outputs: print palettes to terminal, export JSON/URL, validate 10+ predefined test cases (e.g., dark mode, high-contrast).
- Error handling: validate hex inputs, graceful curses fallback to basic CLI if terminal unsupported.
- Keep under 800 lines: use compact curses panels, simple WCAG contrast formula (relative luminance math).
